data.title: Fix bug when app paused the music is still resumed to play after interruption completed.
data.body:
Dear Mingoo,
please review this change for Tizen audio bug.
Thanks a lot.

data.title: Last jpeg lib causes crash on devices with NVIDIA Tegra
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: Asus Eee Pad Transformer TF101

It seems that the last jpeg lib use NEON instructions for armeabi-v7a build. NVIDIA Tegra doesn't support NEON instructions, but supports armeabi-v7a. 
So it causes SIGILL after first using of jpeg lib.

After replacing armeabi-v7a jpeg lib with armeabi everything works fine.

data.title: Lua: have cc.Ray:intersects additionally return the distance
data.body:
cc.Ray:intersects now returns two results, an indication of hit or
not, plus the distance along the ray. The function can still be called
expecting a single argument and hence is backward compatible.

Also correct the debug error message

data.title: Remove unnecessary const return qualifiers
data.body: This PR gets rid of `const` qualifiers from return types which are copy and not reference, for the same reason PR #15132. Thanks.

data.title: [TileMap]Even each tileset only have one image,still can't show correctly.(withTestCase)
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.13.1
- devices test on: chrome 
- developing environments
  - NDK version:
  - Xcode version:
  - VS version:
  - browser type and version:chrome  53.0.2785.143
  - Tiled Map Editor 0.17.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. try to load tiled map attached here:[tilemap.zip](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/519080/tilemap.zip)
   
   use this code : 
   
      `var map = new cc.TMXTiledMap(res.map_tmx);`
      `this.addChild(map, 2, TAG_TILE_MAP);`
2. run the game in browser.

NOTE: in this map , each tileset only have one image. but have 8 tilesets.

[tilemap.zip](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/519080/tilemap.zip)

data.title: Missing cc.clone in JSB
changing transform on a sprite child affect its sprite parent
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.10, javascript
- devices test on: PC 
- developing environments
  - brower type and version: chrome

Steps to Reproduce:
1.   create a sprite, the parent. 
2.  attach a new sprite (the child) to the parent.
3. change rotation or scale in the child (setRotation, setScale). the parent is also affected.

I was expecting that the modifications affect only the child, but they somehow are affecting the parent too.

data.title: TMXTilesetInfo doesn't support  every tile in one tileset have separate image
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: all
- developing environments
  - NDK version:
  - Xcode version: 7.3.1
  - VS version:
  - brower type and version:all

Steps to Reproduce:
1. try to load some tile map like this:
   `<tileset firstgid="1" name="Walls" tilewidth="512" tileheight="512" tilecount="8" columns="0">
   <tile id="0">
   <image width="512" height="512" source="walls/wall-01.png"/>
   </tile>
   <tile id="1">
   <image width="512" height="512" source="walls/wall-02.png"/>
   </tile>
   <tile id="2">
   <image width="512" height="512" source="walls/wall-03.png"/>
   </tile>
   <tile id="3">
   <image width="512" height="512" source="walls/wall-04.png"/>
   </tile>
   <tile id="4">
   <image width="512" height="512" source="rock/rock-01.png"/>
   </tile>
   <tile id="5">
   <image width="512" height="512" source="rock/rock-02.png"/>
   </tile>
   <tile id="6">
   <image width="512" height="512" source="rock/rock-03.png"/>
   </tile>
   <tile id="7">
   <image width="512" height="512" source="rock/rock-04.png"/>
   </tile>
   </tileset>`

which tileset has many separate image, cocos can not load it correctly.
It seems the TMXTilesetInfo assume one tileset only have one image.
but every tile in one tileset have separate image is valid in TileMap.

you can try to load tile map in https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/spine-superspineboy.git
in folder :assets-raw/tiles

Yes, I know, use atlas for one tileset is better.

data.title: issue #16661: Replace c style uthash with std::unordered_map<K, V> in CCFontFNT.cpp
data.body: Please see issue https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/16661

data.title: Replace c style uthash with std::unordered_map<K, V>
data.body:
Now we're using c++11 and have replaced some part of uthash code since v3.0,
but not all code which uses uthash was modified.
The performance of `std::unordered_map` is good enough, therefore we could safely replace all uthash code with `std::unodrdered_map<K, V>`, it will be more c++ friendly and readable.

Currently, there are serval modules are using uthash:

![uthash-modules](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/493372/19211645/07960848-8d74-11e6-884b-c7c6c8cb828e.png)

TODO LIST:
- [X] FontFNT: Fixed at https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16662
- [ ] ActionManager
- [x] GLProgram: Just include `base/uthash.h`, but there isn't anywhere uses it. Fixed at https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16662
- [ ] Scheduler
- [ ] cocos2d_specifics

data.title: [ci skip]correct search path
fix mac system font creation with NSFont
data.body: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/16635

data.title: Remove unnecessary arguments from some lua cc.mat4 methods
data.body:
cc.mat4 methods transformVector, createTranslation and createRotation all take an argument called dst
that is unused, either for passing a value in or out. This commit removes the unnecessary argument and
updates the test files correspondingly.

data.title: Suppress unused function warning
data.body:
When compiling libcocos2d for Mac with Xcode 8.0, I get this "unused function" warning.

```
cocos/vr/CCVRGenericHeadTracker.cpp:130:13: unused function 'getRotateEulerMatrix' [-Wunused-function]
```

In this PR, I add conditional-compilation directives to prevent the warning.
Thanks.

data.title: Mac edit box bug fixes
data.body: - Don't allow multiline to overflow bounds of box (see below for screenshots) - Fix bug w/ performSelector **Before (Kind of hard to see, but notice there is a black border around the email box while editing)** **After**

data.title: Correct the Skybox fov
data.body:
The Skybox implementation didn't correctly account for the camera's field of view and aspect ratio. This
showed particularly badly if the camera was pointed down and rotated, which produced a deformation
of the image as it rotated. On of these commits corrects that.

Also, while analysing this, it was noticed that the skybox implementation was using an unnecessarily
complicated mesh with faces that were never rendered. That is corrected in one of the other commits.

The one other commit removes all setScale applied to skyboxes from the test code. The skybox
implementation makes no use of the MVP transform and hence is uneffected by scaling operations.

data.title: cocos2d-x js-test IOS--Sprite3D
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:3.13.1
- devices test on:ios simulator iphone5s/9.3
- developing environments
  - NDK version:
  - Xcode version:7.3.1
  - VS version:
  - brower type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. play js-test (Sprite 3D test)
2. play every case and next to cubemap and skybox test.
3. tap next.
4. game will crash in Sprite3D::getMesh-->_meshes.at(0);

trigger this assert:
CCASSERT( index >= 0 && index < size(), "index out of range in getObjectAtIndex()");
